titleStmt.title: John E. Hamilton to J. B. Monroe, Jr.
CWG2477

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
Law & Collection Office
-- OF --
JNO. E. HAMILTON.

Attorney at Law, Examiner and Notary Public,
N. E. Corner 4th and Scott Streets. (up stairs)
Covington, Ky., March 28th 1861,

p.note: Collections made throughout the States of Kentucky Ohio Indiana and Missouri.
Clients informed fo prospects of making claims by return Mail.

body.p:
Hon T. B. Monroe Jr.
Dr Sir
W. N. Dora Esq desires the appointment as Commissioner of deeds for Ohio,
Mr Dora lives on this side but does business in Cincinnati, he considers Covington his home but only sleeps here part of the time, his business is note broker & not estate agent.
If consistent please make have the above appointment made. Mr Dora is a gentleman well worthy of the favor. I enclose his card & you will please direct the commission to him as per card.

And oblige
Vry Truly &c
Jno E Hamilton

Ohio
Comr. of DeedsÂ
W. A. Dora
Cincinnati
Comd Apr 11. 1861.
